segments.text: I catch a glimpse of the overflowing sink and feel a mix of frustration and disbelief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How is she so focused on that plate when water is taking over her kitchen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how she hasn’t realized the chaos brewing beneath her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m surprised at how absorbed she seems, as if the world outside her little bubble has stopped.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are in their own world, committed to their little heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy stretching, his determination written all over his face, reaching for that jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something audacious about it, and I can’t help but admire his spirit despite the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But with every inch he climbs, my heart sinks; it’s a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him, waiting with her hand raised, fuels his ambition, making it feel like a sweet conspiracy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet I can’t shake the feeling that one wrong move will shatter this moment of joy.
segments.speaker: PAR
